title: owlcatz
author: owlcatz
content: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5452735.msg62352796#msg62352796Holy hell, it's a stolen/hacked/sold account. I hope nobody pays this guy with no escrow lol... I did read it and holy shit, what a mess... Why locked? Thoughts/comments? red Trust left... Looks to be a stolen/purchased account too!!

comments.author: av8rjeff
comments.body: In my opinion, the move to updating the entire list, even if you were just bidding on 1 lot, was the culprit.Â  With 14 lots, that made it very confusing to keep track of time stamps at the end when bidding was furious.

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: I sent PMs for escrow payments... so hopefully funds should be safeQuote from: av8rjeff on June 04, 2023, 08:53:40 PMIn my opinion, the move to updating the entire list, even if you were just bidding on 1 lot, was the culprit.Â  With 14 lots, that made it very confusing to keep track of time stamps at the end when bidding was furious.Agreed... I even recommended to them in the beginning to split it up into 2x auctions to make it easierAnd reposting every bid every time is definitely not good for either bidders or sellers...my 2 Satoshi from a dude who just ships packages!!

comments.author: av8rjeff
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on June 04, 2023, 08:54:33 PM...my 2 Satoshi from a dude who just ships packages!!  Ahhh...you do a lot more than that for this community.

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: I still donâ€™t think he awarded correct winning bidders based on OP rules, oh well I guess.

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: I stayed away from this, didn't feel too great regarding the (even though very old) negative trust. Still was thinking about bidding, but then prices went above my head anyways. Â Also, can someone direct me to a forum archive where you can see deleted posts please?Btw: I would have an idea for a solution to resolve this. Correct me if it's a stupid idea.How about setting a date, maybe similar time next Sunday, and continuing with 15 minutes left of auction time from a "snapshot" of the bidding list before the chaos regarding the uncertainty of ending time began?And why is the original topic already closed?

comments.author: Spokanistan51
comments.body: Likely closed because he didnâ€™t want to continue to get comments being called out on how the auction went down. Quote from: Kryptowerk on June 05, 2023, 01:00:03 AMI stayed away from this, didn't feel too great regarding the (even though very old) negative trust. Still was thinking about bidding, but then prices went above my head anyways. comments.author: BTCOVERFIATS
comments.body: I knew that auction was doomed the moment everyone started bidding in USD and not BTC

comments.author: Steeley
comments.body: Quote from: blucepheus on June 04, 2023, 08:48:28 PM   itâ€™s a BS account?It has to be right? The OP seems to have jumped ship versus engaging and trying to get a happy resolve. It is one thing to mess up, but this whole things seems like someone who has not seen an auction and is foreign to the forum versus a long standing member from 2011. I have wondered a little about the pictures of the coins. They never felt like photos someone took pictures of themselves, and now in retrospect, none of of asked for proof of ownership. I think Owlcatz is right, this is probably a hacked account and we were getting played. Fortunately most of us do a good job using escrow and being suspicious. Steeley

Scam, legit?Lot 2 InelasticSupplyLot 13 jackbauercsgoLot 8 elianiteYea idk what to say other than this was complete luck one of my bids hit. Iâ€™m fine with everything since weâ€™re escrowing with mj & tbh I worry more for him than us, hoping itâ€™s not some long con to connect with him irl or something. So be safe MJ! comments.author: aoluain
comments.body: Quote from: av8rjeff on June 04, 2023, 09:01:52 PMQuote from: minerjones on June 04, 2023, 08:54:33 PM...my 2 Satoshi from a dude who just ships packages!!  Ahhh...you do a lot more than that for this community. Â Yea and he runs very smooth auctions on a weekly basis! more than just a box shipper!After reading through the 10 pages of that auction it really did turn into a completemess and cant understand why there wasnt a re-run obviously the winners of the 14 lots are kind of happy since they won something but it was clearly a flawed and compromised auction.The OP should have forseen that it was going to be a frenzied finish and difficult to keep track. I feel sorry for the people who were kind of hard done by.

comments.author: anonymousminer
comments.created_time: June 06, 2023, 01:53:14 PMLast edit: June 06, 2023, 02:08:03 PM by anonymousminer
comments.body: I logged in after a long time just to give red trust to that moron.Â  I think more should do the same.Â  I never had issues with large auctions.... oh yeah... i watched and updated it myself.Â  I wasn't a lazy fucktard like that Garret person!Â  ....and TBH shame on all who participated in that auction anyway... bids should be in BTC as it's a BTC forum!Â  Funny how the tail wags the dog when something shiny is up for grabs.

I prefer to use btc, to be clear. From what I have been told, bids can be in any currency and payment also... but BTC MUST be an option.Mitchell would know more...

comments.author: Mitchell
comments.body: Quote from: minerjones on June 06, 2023, 08:27:48 PMFrom what I have been told, bids can be in any currency and payment also... but BTC MUST be an option.Mitchell would know more...The way I moderated was this, if it's in the Bitcoin section of the forum (which Marketplace is), you should accept Bitcoin. You can accept anything else as well, but Bitcoin must be one of them, otherwise it has be in the Altcoin section.
